8Nq9NbPRYc1rl8XWEgMl1Q.text: The cafe was located just across the bus stop, second level of the shop house. Just walk up from the stairs from the side.The place was fairly empty when we reached but was packed with a queue by the time we left.Arbite Breakfast ($18++)Scrambled eggs, bacon, roasted chickpea, tomato, and basil salad, pork Cumberland sausage, sauteed locally farmed mushrooms, toasted brioche and pommes noisettesThe serving was quite big, with a bit of everything. Duck and Eggs ($14++)Poached eggs, duck rillette, sauteed locally farmed mushrooms, hollandise, croissant and fresh greensThe croissant was light and crispy, which cut through easily, topped with the creamy duck rillette.Coco Amethyst ($6++)Coconut water, blue pea flower syrup + lime juiceThe drink turned to a lighter shade of purple colour after pouring in the lime juice. The drink was refreshing to have especially when outside was so hot.Fresh Strawberry Milkshake ($7++)Served with whipped creamThe drink was rich and creamy without too sweet.

Sh78e-QYBiycbpUsWmBEoA.text: 3.5/5The photos have raved me up so much that I was rather disappointed. I guess part of the reason comes from the fact that I travelled a really far distance to get to Arbite. I mean, non of the MRT stations are near it... Service: very busy restaurant on a Sunday. Everyone was waiting for a seat while several tables were reserved and empty. Food came relatively quickly but servers were not paying much attention to us. Food: great ideas but lacked the delivery punch. I really wanted the salted egg yolks fries, travelled for them. But the fries were too thin and crispy and had not enough potato in them..I also had the salted egg yolk crab pasta. The sauce was too liquidy so you can't taste much salted egg yolk in them. Pasta itself was a little too cooked. The soft shell crab was tasty though. I had the fizzy sunrise to drink, which reminded me of cough syrup. Boo. My sister had the pork roulade. I love the melted cheese but the dish didn't have enough balance so it got too much after a while. Overall, average cafe. Will not travel the distance again to get ok only food...

photos.caption: Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Salted egg yolk fries - great if you like macdonald's style thin and crispy fried. I found the flavor mild
Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Salted egg yolk crab pasta. Salted egg yolk flavor was not as strong as I would like it to be
Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Pork roulade - basically like chicken cordon bleu but with pork. Tasty but gets overwhelming after a few bites

wNEanjqGcdu1qYgOAm436Q.text: I have heard plenty of good things about Arbite so I am sorely disappointed when I finally get the chance to go there for brunch. It should have come with a warning - bring ear plugs. The place was crowded on Saturday late morning, filled with kids and young adults. Maybe it was the clientele too as my friend said it was not so noisy during dinner even when it was full house. We could hardly hear ourselves talk, we could hear conversations from people around us, turning us into unintentionally eavesdroppers. When the children threw tantrums or when the babies wailed, and the parents did nothing about it, you just want to walk out or talk to the parents. I guess concrete walls and stark furnishings just do not help in managing the acoustics factor of the place. We had the Arbite breakfast which was filled with everything you want. Unfortunately half the food was cold, and the strong air conditioning blowing directly on the food did not help either. The bacon was awful, tasted like it was cooked in old oil, and it was very greasy. It left a heavy oily feeling in the guts. Needless to say, I did not finish the food. We left quickly as the din was just too much and went elsewhere to have a much needed cup of coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Arbite breakfast

arU0gc_WT0uo9UGjKwiEsg.text: Not quite 4 stars but more than 3 for sure. I had the Arbite burger, which like all great burgers, is a messy affair to eat! Best eaten with your hands and not with dainty bites either. The patty was moist and still slightly pink. The sunny side up egg was cooked just right and oozed when broken to add to the flavour with the crisply fried onion rings adding a nice crunch to each bite. The fries aren't the usual skinny type but cut from whole potatoes and fried. My meal was completed with the delicious lychee freeze.

-0lWattaSmaPCrGnm7orTw.text: After successfully hunting down the cafe, we were welcomed by a clean and chic interior. Amongst the 3 of us, we had:1) Mushroom Soup - this came as part of a set and it's quite good. Not out of a can for sure. 2) Seared Seabass in cream sauce - expected fishy taste but it was actually very delightful. Flavourful but not heavy with the cream sauce. 3) Baked Seafood Pasta - fresh ingredients with the pasta done al dente. Though I found the pasta slightly bland, easily fixed with a few dash of salt. 4) Hamburger - daughter had that she liked it enough.  5) Cheesecake - these came complimentary because my daughter was enjoying her lunch with such looks of happiness. Haha... Cheesecake was nice enough. Not the heavy type without losing the flavour. Will return if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Cheesecake
Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Baked Seafood Pasta
Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Hamburger

40Hw81C5MN9z8TKzLAiQ7Q.text: attentive service but hollandaise sauce needs more tweaking.Great for a girlie brunch out and I love it when food is served piping hot, I have had some experiences whereby the food is waiting by the counter or was obviously reheated but never this place!will be visiting soon

nJ6iaF6hpWI7hTGX0k2G7A.text: In the four years I've been away in LA, many brunch places have popped up all over Singapore. Unfortunately, many of them fail to get the perfect hearty american breakfast right... That is, until I met Arbite. Possibly one of the best brunch places I've experienced in Singapore, everything we sampled here was delicious. I got the Hearty Breakfast but some of the other things I tried were the Eggs Benedict, the Smoked Salmon Crossiant and Truffle Fries. All delicious. The Hearty Breakfast was everything I wanted in a breakfast, the toast was perfect, thick and buttery, the eggs and sausage were well fried, as were the mushrooms and tomato. The bacon wasn't too crispy nor too soft and the potato balls were a nice welcomed addition.The Eggs Benedict was done with  prosciutto instead of regular ham, and together with the eggs and hollandaise sauce, it made for a simple yet yummy meal. The Truffle Fries were thick (if that's how you like your fries) and came with some sort of dip. The service was good and while this place lacks a little of the "indie/chic" factor (not that it gave off the impression of trying to be indie in the first place), it was definitely a nice simple spot for a relaxing weekend breakfast, with yummy food and good service to boot! Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Thick Cut Truffle Fries
Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Egg Benedict
Photo of Arbite - Singapore, Singapore. Hearty Breakfast

UlT_xGzuMxaDBJK6RFggIw.text: Second chance, second visit.Nothing on the 1-for-1 set lunch menu interests us, so we went ala carte. Still nothing memorable, just ok la.

7PmbAbAhEXo9BOtNXKrsDg.text: With are six all-day breakfast mains to choose from, it really depends on whether you're feeling sweet or savoury. So far, I've had the Gardener French Toast -  two 'blocks' of ciabatta bread stuffed with a rich almond and dark chocolate ganache with candied bacon strips on the side when I was feeling sweet and the sea salt caramel banana pancakes when I wanted something simple. While common sense would dictate that I would love The Frittata - an Italian-style open face omelette choc-a-bloc with bacon, asparagus, mushrooms, potatoes, tomatoes and olives - I've yet to give it a go. But I will do so soon as it is highly recommended by friends.

4aWyeEMHSfyFRSQ6ICYo6A.text: I love Arbite!Really, this place is great. I can't believe I only discovered it recently, since I live near the Gardens. I blame the fact that it is tucked beside the giant Sushi Tei near the circular bus stop, and it's on the second floor. If not for reading about it on food blogs I would never have gone to try it!I am so glad I did. The first time round I tried their big breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed myself. The place, even though small, has quite a good ambience with wooden chairs and tables and even a shelf for books. It is rather Ikea-style. The second time I went was to try their pastas. They make their own! Their green tea pasta was so good. It was al dente and very flavorful. I also had it with my favorite cider, the Elderflower and Lime. All in all this is a super great place for brunch and pastas. Their burgers are alright. Go for what I recommended instead!

Aq9u2--LBdyg0fY8t98dGg.text: The ambience at Arbite is really great. When you walk in, you see little lego stacked strategically in the holes in the walls left by the previous tenants, or so they claim. It's a small place that does fusion food, but I've only tried the brunch and coffee here. Walking up into the quaint and intimate dining on the 2nd floor was nice. The glass windows meant you had a view of Serangoon Gardens.I ordered the big breakfast and it was... a big breakfast. The bacon was very crispy but a little too salty, and my poached eggs were poached to perfection. The sausages were nothing special, so all in all, I do not feel that it is great value for money. It is definitely a hearty breakfast or brunch for the late-riser or hungover soul, but I'm not impressed enough to keep coming back. Service here was fast and efficient, though the staff were not very friendly. Being a coffee snob, the watery, milky coffee served here was definitely not a great latte, but neither was it horrible. A mediocre experience in my books. Perhaps I will come back to try the other dishes, but I seem to have lost the motivation from this first experience.

SLaf6ygnAIjboK8rAN1aUA.text: I came here for Saturday brunch with my sister, and I have to say that it will probably not be on my top list of brunch places anytime soon. I find the place a little too cramped, the tables are too close to one another, and it is a pretty tight space. The acoustics in this place is not the best as well, so a packed crowd really is a little too much for the ears to bear. It was not my notion of a restful weekend brunch. The breakfast platter that my sister had was pretty decent looking and tasting, but my lobster mac-and-cheese was waaaaayyy too creamy for me to eat more than four bites. i think this place has potential and it is probably a much more pleasant place to eat at during dinnertime, but I will not be returning for brunch anytime soon.

u_zm9f9lIfql5TlyArwh8Q.text: Arbite is quite a charming little place right smack in the middle of Serangoon Gardens Circus. You climb upstairs and if you're lucky, a nice window seat will let you have a good view of the circus outside.The Tri Pepper Spaghettini with Soft Shell Crab was quite good, but I really have to give props to the Japanese Curry Pulled Pork Wrap. which was lots of soft tender pork with japanese curry and veg wrapped in a nice soft tortilla shell, absolutely delicious. Something I would definitely order again when I come back!

tSfcxQQS_Uli1JAO_mam4A.text: Always up for trying places that offer all day breakfast ... So it was only a matter of time till I made the trek over to serangoon gardens to try arbite. We had the eggs Benny and the truffle burger plus sides and drinks for a very reasonable s$48. The food was good but not great - maybe the burger was too heavy for brunch. The vanilla milkshake was a miss for me - too thin and watery.Loved the ambience and buzz and always good to go places where you don't see expats :)Not sure I would make it back for brunch though... It's a bit far and like I said it wasn't unforgettable. Maybe worth trying for dinner next time

n1Rbc1HgquoK1-o46XWCOg.text: This place is a 3 minutes walk from my house! The Green Tea Fettucini with Smoked Duck ($24.90) was crazy good. With a little bit of feta cheese on top, it was great addition. The pasta is al dente, and bursting with flavour.  They also serve Kopparberg Elderflower & Lime cider ($11) which is really refreshing and sweet. Also worth a try is the Pappardelle with Mushrooms and Parma Ham ($19.90) which was served with parma ham and cream sauce topped with truffle oil.

Tn61S4So7GdY713ysyeZ8g.text: The deco looks cheap..sorry, this place has no Personality..disappointing..Food wasn't too bad, else would be only one star! Ordered a poached egg brunch..pricey though..Noisy, it's the customers profile..mostly families with kids on a late Sunday morning. Service's real bad, don't think the staff were properly trained. They seemed to be students working for their pocket money, had to ask for my essentials, sugar and then teaspoon when I was served my tea. How to stir?! Not proactive as these should come with the beverage. Had to remind the server for my request of additional sauce with my food which was done earlier on when placing my order. I felt my irritation ( I dislike having to keep asking for essential things!..Just show how slack they were! )as they did not deliver even basic service, had to be prompted for the slightest things. Would  prefer to self help to make things quicker for myself which I did to get an extra packet of sugar as I knew where they were placed. And yes, with such slack service, there's the 10% service charge with the bill. Had a good mind not to pay, which I did,  I will never return. Went off quickly after my meal. The place sucks big time!
